Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a red-brown pottery ribbed vessel, the fabric is relatively coarse with white inclusions and pink-grey in section, the exterior is covered with a red-brown slip and faint traces of two lines of Coptic text written in black ink.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393306) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393306)
